inlineContent.text: The Navigation SDK for iOS allows you to build a custom navigation experience with the power of the

abstract.text: The Navigation Core framework provides the basic components for the custom navigation experience.

An edge in a routing graph. For example, an edge may represent a road segment between two intersections or
between the two ends of a bridge. An edge may traverse multiple road objects, and a road object may be
associated with multiple edges.

A
indicates the level of traffic congestion along a road segment relative to the normal flow of
traffic along that segment. You can color-code a route line according to the congestion level along each segment of
the route.
The error describing a possible cause of failing to instantiate the
object.
Describes the relationship between the road object and the direction of a eferenced line. The road object may be
directed in the same direction as the line, against that direction, both directions, or the direction of the road
object might be unknown.
A
object specifies turn-by-turn-optimized criteria for results returned by the Mapbox Map
Matching API.
A
object indicates a location along a route. It may be the route’s origin or destination, or it may be
another location that the route visits. A waypoint object indicates the location’s geographic location along with
other optional information, such as a name or the user’s direction approaching the waypoint.
Contains information about distance to the road object of a concrete type/shape (gantry, polygon, line, point etc.).
Configures the rerouting behavior.
Describes a road shield information.
The
provides methods for responding to events triggered by the
A
object defines a single leg of a route between two waypoints. If the overall route has only two
waypoints, it has a single
object that covers the entire route. The route leg object includes
information about the leg, such as its name, distance, and expected travel time. Depending on the criteria used to
calculate the route, the route leg object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.

The road object can be on the right side of the road, on the left side of the road, on both sides of the road or
directly on the road.

Each alert type corresponds to a specific traffic condition or event that can affect the route.

You can pair this with a custom feedback UI in your app to flag problems during navigation such as road
closures, incorrect instructions, etc.
